result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:40 PM Defendant Rodney C Hoeper appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Greg Venturini appeared by video for Rodney C Hoeper.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Venturini requests this matter be set for a status conference so the defendant can take care of some of his medical needs. Attorney Knaapen doesn't object. 
This matter will be set for a status conference.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on May 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:02 AM Defendant Rodney C Hoeper appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Greg Venturini in court for Rodney C Hoeper. 
Attorney Knaapen gives an argument against a bond modification. Attorney Venturini makes an argument for a bond reduction or to adjust the furlough order. Defendant is requesting to get himself to his appointments when he is let out on furloughs. 
Court denies the bond modification. However, he will allow the defendant to take cabs at his expense to his appointments or get himself to his appointments - Amended furlough.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in court with attorney Greg Venturini.  Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney C Hoeper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Atty Venturini moves the court to amend the bond to signature bond and rely on the $1800 cash posted in the OWI case.  Atty Knaapen objects to the bond modification.  Court denies the motion to modify the bond.

01:35 PM Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in court with attorney Greg Venturini.  Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney C Hoeper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Atty Venturini waives the preliminary hearing.  Court questions Hoeper regarding his waiver and accepts.  Matter is bound over for Arraignment.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
defendant's motion to modify bond

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: withdrawal Attorney Weiland

This was technically an adjourned hearing not a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.

11:14 AM Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Weiland waives the preliminary hearing.  Court questions Hoeper regarding his waiver.  Asks to set the preliminary hearing off to talk with another atty.  Court extends the time limits to hold the preliminary hearing.  Atty Weiland moves the court to withdraw as counsel.  Court grants the motion to withdraw and asks that Atty Weiland file the standard order.  Public Defender to appoint new counsel.  Hoeper wants Atty Weiland off all of his cases.  Court sets for Status Conf.  Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:45 AM Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in court with attorney William George Weiland.  Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in custody.  David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney C Hoeper appeared by video means with Attorney.
Attorney Weiland states that Kim Bauernfeind is a friend of defendant and is present today. She is willing to transport defendant to the Clinic for medical appointments.
Court explains what the responsibility would be for her to transport defendant to his appointments without stopping anywhere on the way to or from the appointments. She would be subject to criminal charges if defendant violated his conditions of bond or furlough. Kimberly Bauernfeind understands and she accepts the responsibility. Attorney Knaapen questions witness.
Court grants furlough request. Court will provide Ms. Bauernfeind with list of rules.
for Furlough

01:55 PM Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in court, in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney C Hoeper appeared by video means.
Defendant is requesting a furlough for medical treatment. State is opposed to a furlough.
Court denies furlough for him to go on his own. The Sheriff's Department can transport him to the clinic, but then he needs to be transported back to the jail. Court may consider a third party to transport him to medical appointments, but that person will be interviewed by Judge Wolf.
Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on January 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Absolute sobriety.

01:38 PM Defendant Rodney C Hoeper in court, in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rodney C Hoeper appeared by video means.
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This matter will be bound over for preliminary hearing.
